Sion, 2024-02-04 
Benjamin Mora 
Outside Sales – French speaking Area (VS-VD-FR)  
 
 
 
 
 
 
Good Morning Gentlemen, 
 
Firstly, I would like to thank you again for the time you spent with me last Friday afternoon during the Teams’ Call. As 
requested, I send you (via Jan – this is why I write in English) my feedback/thoughts about this Call. 
 
To summarize our call, I will split it in 4 parts: 
 
1. Inside-Sales / Estimation Dpt / Team Leader: Iwan (ZH) 
2. Outside-Sales / Sales Dpt / Team Leader: Andrea (TI) 
3. Open Questions 
4. JCI Development 
 
 
1. Inside-Sales / Estimation Dpt / Team Leader: Iwan (ZH) 
We talk briefly about eventually an open position based in Le Mont-sur-Lausanne. This position is the ‘budy’ of the 
Outside-Sales and his tasks are to finalize the Sales-Process by providing a quotation of the solution purposed by the 
Outside-Sales, validated by the Estimation Department, and then to do the follow-up (order/deliveries). 
 
 I’m not interested by this position due to the lack of ‘face-to-face’ contacts with the Prospects. 
 
 
2. Outside-Sales / Sales Dpt / Team Leader: Andrea (TI) 
The open position to replace your actual colleague – leaving at the end of February – was originally to cover the whole 
“Valais/Wallis”. Following internal discussion, you found a solution with a native Swiss-German colleague (knowing 
the Hochwalliser Deutch ) to cover the German area, which is a better solution to keep and develop this area than to 
use a native French speaking employee. I agree with you on this topic. 
 
Therefor you suggested me to cover the French area of the “Valais/Wallis” and additionally to take care too of the 
area between Sion-Lausanne-Yverdon and, if needed, to replace the colleague in charge of the Geneva Area. 
This position as Outside-Sales is to lead Projects by End-Users (i.e. Municipalities, SMB Companies, Industrial 
Companies, Private Schools, Rental Buildings, etc.) with a greater priority in fire alarm solutions connected to the 118 
firefighters ARC (AEAI/VKF standards) than in video-surveillance or access control (intercoms) installations. 
 
My time will be spent mainly on the road and by the Prospects in this above French speaking Area and, from time to 
time, in Le Mont-sur-Lausanne for some internal Meetings, Trainings, Technical Support and Activities with the 
Estimation Dpt. 
 
 I’m interested by this position to look for the best suitable solution and to present it in front of the End-User, 
meaning ‘face-to-face’ discussions and on-site to provide explanations and answers. 
 
  

 
 
 
 
3. Open Questions 
After our call, I take some time to think about the job activities of the Outside-Sales and the main questions I have are: 
 
- Internal Trainings held by Johnson Controls to be aware of the AEAI/VKF standards (I already downloaded 
their “Norme de protection incendie” 01.01.2015)? 
A revisited version of this standard is in preparation for 2026 (PPI 2026) so I need then to stay up to date. 
 
- How is Johnson Controls aware of the Projects from/by the End-Users? 
- Architects’ Offices communications (for new buildings’ installations or renewal of buildings) 
- Working with external Companies by buying pre-selected Leads to discover potential Prospects 
- Working with existing Customers to inform them about new Standards (Installation to be upgraded) 
- Mainly Cold-Visits / Cold-Calls (not necessary the best ROI solution) 
 
 
4. JCI Development 
I talked above about my feelings und understanding following our Teams’ Call. In this 4th part, I would like to get your 
feelings about following points: 
 
- How well is this area developed – as per today, long-term or short-term Customers? 
 
- Who are the main Competitors and/or Blockers – which Challenges to increase JCI’s 
Success in this Area? 
 
- Cross-Selling / Up-Selling thanks other JCI’s Departments or from other JCI’s Locations 
for Customers with different Subsidiaries throughout Switzerland? 
 
- Actually, in this Area, which is the average % from Projects turned into Sales? 
 
- Actual Customers are requesting new Products/Solutions (i.e. more integrated AI), or
